item.title: Pittsburgh's job trend
item.description: How does Pittsburgh’s job trend compare to that of other metro areas? Here’s the short answer showing the annual average total nonfarm payroll for each metro indexed to 2006. The general trend line is shown in blue and Pittsburgh’s trend is shown in yellow. The metros are divided into four groups based on how their job growth generally compares to the overall trend line. The clustering method I used put Pittsburgh in the “Slightly Better” group although that’s mainly based on its performance between 2008 and 2014.

item.title: Public sector jobs in Pittsburgh and other metros
item.description: How does Pittsburgh’s public sector employment compare to that of other metro areas? In this first glance, I’m going to focus on what percentage of the metro area’s jobs are government jobs. The data comes from the Bureau of Labor Statistics monthly survey of state and local employment. I use the annual averages, so the latest data is for 2017.
